meanings.definition: To live or travel like a Gypsy.
meanings.sent1: She gypsied through Europe, embracing the nomadic lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The family gypsied across the countryside in their colorful caravan.
meanings.sent3: The young girl gypsied around the campsite, pretending to be on a grand adventure.
meanings.sent4: His heart gypsied with the freedom of the open road.
meanings.sent5: The old man's eyes sparkled with memories of gypsied days under the stars.

meanings.sent1: He gypsied unsuspecting tourists with his fake gemstones.
meanings.sent2: The con artist gypsied many people out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat gypsied the dog out of its treat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile gypsied him into believing her lies.
meanings.sent5: The magician gypsied the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.sent1: The children gypsied around the park, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent2: The lost dog gypsied through the neighborhood in search of home.
meanings.sent3: The wind gypsied through the trees, whispering secrets to the leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts gypsied from one idea to the next, never settling.
meanings.sent5: The river gypsied along the valley, reflecting the changing sky.
